'''Brandon Chrostowski''' is an American [[chef]], [[restaurateur]], and [[politician]] currently residing in [[Cleveland]], [[Ohio]]. He is the founder, president, and CEO of EDWINS Leadership and Restaurant Institute, a [[501(c)(3) organization|501(c)(3) non-profit organization]] that acts as both a [[French cuisine|French]] restaurant and a culinary institute located in Cleveland's [[Shaker Square]]. It trains and is staffed largely by former prison inmates and was the subject of the [[90th Academy Awards|2017]] [[Academy Award]]-nominated documentary short, ''[[Knife Skills]]''. Chrostowski is also a certified [[sommelier]] and a [[Cheesemaking|fromager]]. He ran for [[Mayor of Cleveland]] in 2017.

==Early life and education==

Chrostowski was born and grew up in [[Detroit]], [[Michigan]].<ref name=\NPR\">{{cite news | last=Hartke| first=Kristen| title =Oscar-Nominated 'Knife Skills' Showcases Ex-Cons And Odd Ducks In The Kitchen| newspaper =| publisher =NPR| date =3 March 2018 | url =https://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2018/03/03/590357455/oscar-nominated-knife-skills-showcases-ex-cons-and-odd-ducks-in-the-kitchen| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref><ref name=\"CleveMayor\">{{cite news | last=Tobias| first=Andrew J.| title =Edwins restaurant CEO Brandon Chrostowski announces Cleveland mayoral bid| newspaper =| publisher =Cleveland.com| date =2 February 2017 | url =https://www.cleveland.com/cityhall/index.ssf/2017/02/edwins_ceo_brandon_chrostowski.html| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref> When he was 18
column3: he was charged with [[resisting arrest]] after originally being suspected of a drug-related offense.<ref name=\"Esq2018\">{{cite magazine | last=McMahan| first=Dana| title =EDWINS in Cleveland Is Teaching Former Inmates How to Run a Restaurant| magazine =Esquire| date = 2 March 2018| url =https://www.esquire.com/food-drink/restaurants/a13161623/edwins-cleveland-restaurant/| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref> A judge could have imposed a 10-year prison term but instead sentenced Chrostowski to one year of [[probation]].<ref name=\"Crains\">{{cite news | last=Crea| first=Joe| title =Chrostowski returns to Edwins with big plans on tap| newspaper =| publisher =Crain's Cleveland Business| date =8 October 2017 | url =https://www.crainscleveland.com/article/20171006/news/137986/renewed-focus-brandon-chrostowski-makes-big-plans-edwins| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref> Soon after this
column4: he began working with Detroit chef
column5: George Kalergis
column6: who became his mentor.<ref name=\"Crains40\">{{cite news | last=Nobile| first=Jeremy| title =Brandon Chrostowski
column7: 35| newspaper =| publisher =Crain's Cleveland Business| date =21 November 2015 | url =https://www.crainscleveland.com/article/20151121/FORTY15/151129970/brandon-chrostowski-35| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref><ref name=\"Paste\">{{cite magazine | last=Hall| first=Jenn| title =Edwins Restaurant in Cleveland Offers Ex-Offenders a New Start| magazine =Paste| date =22 February 2017 | url =https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2017/02/or-edwins-restaurant-in-cleveland-offers-ex-offend.html| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref> This led him to [[The Culinary Institute of America]] in [[New York (state)|New York]] where he earned an [[associate's degree]] in [[culinary arts]] and a [[bachelor's degree]] in business and restaurant management.<ref name=\"FW2017\">{{cite news | last=Kramer| first=Jillian| title =Meet the Ex-Con Chef Running for Mayor of Cleveland| newspaper =| publisher =Food & Wine| date =28 June 2017 | url =https://www.foodandwine.com/news/politics/brandon-chrostowski-ex-con-chef-cleveland-mayor| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref><ref name=\"Acton\">{{cite news | last=Stanley| first=Sarah| title =Kitchen Redemption: An interview with Brandon Chrostowski| newspaper =| publisher =Religion & Liberty| date =11 November 2015 | url =https://acton.org/kitchen-redemption-interview-brandon-chrostowski| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref>

column2: Chrostowski apprenticed under [[Charlie Trotter]] at his namesake restaurant (Charlie Trotter's) in [[Chicago]].<ref name=\"Cle2013\">{{cite news | last=Kramer| first=Jillian| title =Food for Thought| newspaper =| publisher =Cleveland Magazine| date =30 September 2013 | url =https://clevelandmagazine.com/in-the-cle/people/articles/brandon-chrostowski| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref><ref name=\"DB\">{{cite web | last=Carrier| first=Shannon| title =From Serving Time to Serving Food: EDWINS' Winning Recipe| website =Daily Beast| date =13 October 2018 | url =https://www.thedailybeast.com/from-serving-time-to-serving-food-edwins-winning-recipe| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref> He then moved to [[France]] where he worked under Jean Bardet in [[Tours]]<ref name=\"Fresh2010\">{{cite news | last=Trattner| first=Douglas| title =i live here (now): brandon chrostowski| newspaper =| publisher =FreshWater| date =11 November 2010 | url =http://www.freshwatercleveland.com/features/chrostowski111110.aspx| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref> and [[Alain Senderens]] in [[Paris]]. For six months
column3: he held a position at the Entree chaud and [[patisserie]] station at Senderens' Paris restaurant
column4: Lucas Carton. Around 2005
column5: he returned to the United States
column6: working as [[saucier]] at [[Terrance Brennan]]'s [[Manhattan]] restaurant
column7: Picholine.<ref name=\"Cle2013\"/><ref name=\"CS2015\">{{cite news | last=Trattner| first=Douglas| title =Slow Your Roll: EDWINS Goes Crazy for Tableside Carts| newspaper =Cleveland Scene| date =29 December 2015 | url =https://www.clevescene.com/scene-and-heard/archives/2015/12/29/slow-your-roll-edwins-goes-crazy-for-tableside-carts| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref> He also worked in the kitchens at [[Le Cirque]] and Chanterelle in Manhattan.<ref name=\"DB\"/> He worked his way up to manager at the latter restaurant
column8: which was owned by Karen and David Waltuck.<ref name=\"Cle2013\"/><ref name=\"NYER\">{{cite magazine | last=Larson| first=Sarah| title =An Oscar-Nominated Documentary About Fine Dining and Life After Prison| magazine =New Yorker| date =6 February 2018 | url =https://www.newyorker.com/culture/culture-desk/an-oscar-nominated-documentary-about-fine-dining-and-life-after-prison| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref>

column3: EDWINS Leadership and Restaurant Institute. He had originally written a business plan for the organization in 2004 with the goal of offering professional culinary training
column4: housing
column5: clothing
column6: counseling
column7: and life-skills classes to current and former inmates.<ref name=\"Crains\"/><ref name=\"DB\"/><ref name=\"Cleve2012\">{{cite news | last=Crea| first=Joe| title =L'Albatros Brasserie's Brandon Chrostowski aims to create a restaurant to train
column8: employ ex-offenders| newspaper =| publisher =Cleveland.com| date =25 September 2012 | url =https://www.cleveland.com/dining/index.ssf/2012/09/lalbatros_brasseries_brandon_c.html| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref> The name comes from Chrostowski's own middle name (Edwin)
column9: which he inherited from his grandfather. It is also shorthand for \"Education Wins.\"<ref name=\"CNN\">{{cite news | last=Toner| first=Kathleen| title =Restaurant gives ex-offenders a recipe for success| newspaper =| publisher =CNN| date =17 March 2016 | url =https://www.cnn.com/2016/03/17/us/cnnheroes-brandon-chrostowski-edwins-cleveland/index.html| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref><ref name=\"CleveBeard\">{{cite news | last=Snook| first=Debbi| title =Edwins' Cleveland team takes on New York City
column10: Oscars
column11: tonight's dinner (photos)| newspaper =The Plain Dealer| publisher =| date =24 January 2018 | url =https://www.cleveland.com/cooking/index.ssf/2018/01/edwins_cleveland_team_takes_on.html| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref> Chrostowski moved to Cleveland in around 2008.<ref name=\"Cle2013\"/><ref name=\"Forbes\">{{cite magazine | last=Husock| first=Howard| title =Cooking
column12: Not Crime: Ex-Cons Hot In Cleveland| magazine =Forbes| date =3 September 2015 | url =https://www.forbes.com/sites/howardhusock/2015/09/03/cooking-not-crime-ex-cons-hot-in-cleveland/#2ace7215a44e| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref> While there
column13: he earned a job as a manager at the French [[brasserie]]
column14: L'Albatros. He would later become the restaurant's sommelier
column16: and general manager.<ref name=\"Cle2013\"/><ref name=\"Fresh2010\"/><ref name=\"Cleve2012\"/>

column1: ===2008–2016: Life in Cleveland and founding EDWINS===

column2: Chrostowski began to raise money for his EDWINS venture via fundraisers and private donations.<ref name=\"Cle2013\"/><ref name=\"Forbes\"/> Initially
column3: he developed an EDWINS program for currently imprisoned inmates at the [[Grafton Correctional Institution]] and the Northeast Pre-Release Center
column4: <ref name=\"FW2017\"/><ref name=\"Cle2013\"/> which he began in 2011.<ref name=\"DB\"/><ref name=\"HP\">{{cite news | last=Ruiz-Grossman| first=Sarah| title =Chef Who Spent Time In Jail Now Trains Other Ex-Offenders In Culinary Arts| work =HuffPost| date =28 June 2016 | url =https://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/brandon-chrostowski-edwins-leadership-restaurant-institute_us_576c53b3e4b017b379f564d9| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref> In September 2012
column5: Chrostowski publicly revealed his business plan in an effort to garner more donations.<ref name=\"Cleve2012\"/> In March 2013 at a [[TED (conference)|TED Talk]] in Cleveland
column6: he gave a speech about the difficulties former inmates face after being released from prison. He also announced that he would resign from his position at L'Albatros to focus exclusively on EDWINS.<ref name=\"Forbes\"/><ref name=\"FreshTED\">{{cite news | last=O'brien| first=Erin| title =ideas worth spreading: tedxcle hopes to light a fire under our collective behinds| newspaper =| publisher =FreshWater| date =14 March 2013 | url =http://www.freshwatercleveland.com/features/tedxcle2013031413.aspx| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref> In July 2013
column7: he purchased a building in Cleveland's Shaker Square and began renovating it to accommodate the restaurant and training center.<ref name=\"Cle2013\"/> The restaurant opened in November 2013 and was staffed by around 55 former inmates at its outset.<ref name=\"CleveOpening\">{{cite news | last=Crea| first=Joe| title =Edwins Restaurant
column8: outreach to former prisoners returning to workforce
column9: opening Nov. 1| newspaper =| publisher =Cleveland.com| date =23 October 2013 | url =https://www.cleveland.com/dining/index.ssf/2013/10/edwins_restaurant_outreach_to.html| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref> A total of about 80 students entered the initial class with about 35 \"graduating\" the six-month program.<ref name=\"STL\">{{cite news | last=Agnew| first=Jenny| title =Oscar-nominated documentary \"Knife Skills\" examines a restaurant through the eyes of its founder
column10: an ex-convict| newspaper =| publisher =St. Louis Magazine| date =12 March 2018 | url =https://www.stlmag.com/dining/oscar-nominated-Knife-Skills-examines-a-restaurant-through-the-eyes-of-its-founder-an-ex-convict/| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref><ref name=\"FW2018\">{{cite news | last=Sherman| first=Elisabeth| title =Oscar-Nominated Documentary 'Knife Skills' Takes You Behind the Scenes of a Kitchen Run by Ex-Convicts| newspaper =| publisher =Food & Wine| date =24 January 2018 | url =https://www.foodandwine.com/news/oscar-nominated-documentary-knife-skills| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref>

column2: the program had graduated 89 students.<ref name=\"Cleve2015\">{{cite news | last=Jarboe| first=Michelle| title =Edwins Second Chance campus comes together on Cleveland's Buckeye Road (photos)| newspaper =The Plain Dealer| publisher =| date =8 September 2015 | url =https://www.cleveland.com/business/index.ssf/2015/09/edwins_second_chance_campus_co.html| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref> In November of that year
column3: Chrostowski was listed on ''[[Crain's Cleveland Business]]''{{'}} \"Forty Under 40\" list.<ref name=\"Crains40\"/> In March 2016
column4: he was named one of 25 [[CNN Heroes]] for that year.<ref name=\"CNN\"/><ref name=\"CleveCNN\">{{cite news | last=Crea| first=Joe| title =Cleveland's Edwins Restaurant founder named a CNN Hero for 2016| newspaper =| publisher =Cleveland.com| date =18 March 2016 | url =https://www.cleveland.com/dining/index.ssf/2016/03/clevelands_edwins_restaurant_f.html| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref> In August 2016
column5: the EDWINS Second Chance Life Skills Center—a campus composed of three buildings with dormitories
column6: a library
column7: a test kitchen
column8: and fitness center—was completed. Chrostowski had acquired the buildings for the project in Cleveland's Buckeye neighborhood in July 2015. The center is reserved for current members and alumni of the EDWINS program.<ref name=\"Cleve2015\"/><ref name=\"FreshSecond\">{{cite news | last=Connelly Rice| first=Karin| title =Edwins campus completes second phase| newspaper =| publisher =FreshWater| date =29 August 2016 | url =http://www.freshwatercleveland.com/devnews/Edwins082916.aspx| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref><ref name=\"CS2016\">{{cite news | last=Trattner| first=Douglas| title =EDWINS Expands its Reach with New Dorms
column9: Second Chance Life Skills Center | newspaper =Cleveland Scene| date =24 August 2016 | url =https://www.clevescene.com/scene-and-heard/archives/2016/08/24/edwins-expands-its-reach-with-new-dorms-second-chance-life-skills-center| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref> In January 2017
column10: Chrostowski appeared on an episode of ''[[Steve Harvey (talk show)|Steve Harvey]]'' where he was honored as one of \"Harvey's Heroes.\"<ref name=\"CleveHarvey\">{{cite news | last=DeMarco| first=Laura| title =Edwins chef Brandon Chrostowski to be honored on 'The Steve Harvey Show'| newspaper =The Plain Dealer| publisher =| date =25 January 2017 | url =https://www.cleveland.com/entertainment/index.ssf/2017/01/edwins_chef_brandon_chrostowsk.html| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref>

column2: Chrostowski announced his candidacy for the Mayor of Cleveland.<ref name=\"CleveMayor\"/> To focus on his campaign
column3: he took a leave of absence from EDWINS
column4: appointing Tom Nobbe to temporarily fill his role.<ref name=\"Crains\"/> In the September primary election
column5: Chrostowski finished fourth out of nine candidates
column6: accruing 9.5% of the vote and losing to long-time incumbent
column7: [[Frank G. Jackson]].<ref name=\"Idea\">{{cite news | last=Castele| first=Nick| title =Where Cleveland Mayoral Candidates Found Strongest Support| newspaper =| publisher =IdeaStream| date =13 September 2017 | url =http://www.ideastream.org/news/where-cleveland-mayoral-candidates-found-strongest-support| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref> He returned to his position as President of EDWINS soon after the election.<ref name=\"Crains\"/>

column2: EDWINS was also the subject of the [[Thomas Lennon (filmmaker)|Thomas Lennon]]-directed documentary short
column3: ''Knife Skills''. Chrostowski had met Lennon at a dinner party held by his former Chanterelle bosses
column4: Karen and David Waltuck
column5: in September 2013. He later agreed to let Lennon film the run-up to the restaurant's launch. The film largely focuses on EDWINS' opening night in November 2013 along with Chrostowski and the restaurant's trainees. It was nominated for an [[Academy Award for Best Documentary (Short Subject)|Academy Award for Best Documentary Short Subject]] at the [[90th Academy Awards]].<ref name=\"FW2018\"/><ref name=\"CleveFilm\">{{cite news | last=Bona| first=Marc| title =Edwins beginnings in Shaker Square captured in 'Knife Skills' documentary| newspaper =| publisher =Cleveland.com| date =3 October 2017 | url =https://www.cleveland.com/entertainment/index.ssf/2017/10/edwins_beginnings_in_shaker_sq.html| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref> In January 2018
column6: Chrostowski led a group of EDWINS trainees preparing a dinner of fine French cuisine at the [[James Beard Foundation|James Beard House]] in Manhattan.<ref name=\"CleveBeard\"/>

column2: Chrostowski opened the Serenite Restaurant and Culinary Institute in [[Medina
column3: Ohio]]. The restaurant operates similarly to EDWINS but has a focus on individuals recovering from drug and/or alcohol addictions. The center received a $300
column4: 000 grant from the state of Ohio to start the restaurant.<ref name=\"CleveSerenite\">{{cite news | last=Snook| first=Debbi| title =Edwins' Cleveland leaders to open Serenite restaurant in Medina
column5: supporting those recovering from addiction (photos)| newspaper =The Plain Dealer| publisher =| date =1 February 2018 | url =https://www.cleveland.com/cooking/index.ssf/2018/02/edwins_cleveland_leaders_to_op.html| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref><ref name=\"Cle2018\">{{cite news | last=Hannan| first=Sheehan| title =Brandon Chrostowski's Next Fight? Addiction| newspaper =| publisher =Cleveland Magazine| date =12 June 2018 | url =https://clevelandmagazine.com/food-drink/articles/brandon-chrostowski's-next-fight-addiction| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref> Chrostowski has finished the EDWINS Butcher Shop and Cafe near the EDWINS Second Chance Life Skills Center. It opened in December 2018.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.cleveland.com/entertainment/2018/12/edwins-butcher-shop-opens-aiming-to-offer-more-than-just-affordable-cuts-of-meat.html|title=Edwins Butcher Shop opens
column6: aiming to offer more than just affordable cuts of meat|first=Marc|last=Bona|date=December 13
column7: 2018|website=cleveland.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.crainscleveland.com/table/edwins-debuts-butcher-shop-hopes-its-catalyst-more|title=Edwins debuts butcher shop
column8: hopes it's a catalyst for more|date=December 16
column9: 2018|website=Crain's Cleveland Business}}</ref><ref name=\"CSButcher\">{{cite news | last=Trattner| first=Douglas| title =Brandon Chrostowski's Putting Finishing Touches on Edwins Butcher Shop| newspaper =Cleveland Scene| date =24 October 2018 | url =https://www.clevescene.com/cleveland/brandon-chrostowskis-putting-finishing-touches-on-edwins-butcher-shop-opening-soon-in-the-buckeye-shaker-neighborhood/Content?oid=25167381| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref><ref name=\"WOIO\">{{cite news | last=Picciano| first=Jen| title =Edwins opens new butcher shop
column10: Chef Sawyer pens new cookbook; more on Taste Buds| newspaper =| publisher =WOIO| date =30 October 2018 | url =https://www.cleveland19.com/2018/10/30/taste-buds-edwins-new-butcher-shop-chef-sawyers-new-cook-book/| accessdate =24 November 2018}}</ref> Over the course of its existence
column11: the EDWINS program has graduated over 350 former inmates
column12: and EDWINS culinary classes are held in virtually all Ohio prisons.<ref name=\"Esq2018\"/> In July 2019 Chrostowski opened up an Italian eatery helping the homeless. In partnership with the West Side Catholic Center the social enterprise launched on July 19
column13: 2019.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://clevelandmagazine.com/food-drink/articles/first-look-ohio-city-pizzeria|title=First Look: Ohio City Pizzeria|website=clevelandmagazine.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.news5cleveland.com/news/local-news/oh-cuyahoga/ohio-city-pizzeria-reopens-with-expanded-menu-and-new-social-purpose|title=Pizza served up with a purpose in Ohio City|date=July 16
column14: 2019|website=WEWS}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.wksu.org/post/ohio-city-pizzeria-offers-opportunities-former-inmates|title=Ohio City Pizzeria Offers Opportunities For Former Inmates|first=David|last=Williams|website=www.wksu.org}}</ref> Chrostowski has continued his pursuit of building the best culinary school for returning citizens by opening the EDWINS Bakery on December 20
column15: 2019. <ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.cleveland.com/entertainment/2019/12/edwins-bakery-diner-coffee-shop-sets-opening-on-buckeye-road.html|title=EDWINS bakery-diner-coffee shop sets opening on buckeye road|last=Bona|first=Marc|website=www.cleveland.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.wkyc.com/article/life/food/edwins-bakery-opens-buckeye-shaker/95-f474ac8e-39df-4268-80f4-46f236acfabf|title=EDWINS Bakery opens in Cleveland's Buckeye-Shaker neighborhood today|last=Metzger|first=Stephanie|website=www.wkyc.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.news5cleveland.com/lifestyle/food/edwins-bakery-training-center-to-bring-european-sweets-and-breads-to-clevelands-buckeye-neighborhood|title=EDWINS Bakery & Training Center to bring European sweets and breads to Cleveland's Buckeye neighborhood|last=Hlavaty|first=Kaylan|website=www.news5cleveland.com}}</ref> This fresh bakery and \"from scratch\" diner provides a deeper baking and pastry education to students and provides fresh baked goods that \"feed the soul\" to the nearby community.

column1: The commitment that Chrostowski has for community and culinary arts was recognized by the IFMA in March of 2020 naming him a recipient of the prestigous Silver Plate award. <ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.cleveland.com/entertainment/2020/03/brandon-chrostowski-named-silver-plate-recipient.html|title=Brandon Chrostowski named Silver Plate recipient|last=Bona|first=Marc|website=www.cleveland.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.cbsnews.com/video/ohio-chef-aims-to-give-ex-convicts-a-second-chance/|title=Ohio chef aims to give ex-convicts a second chance|last=Glor|first=Jeff|website=www.cbsnews.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.clevelandjewishnews.com/features/nosh/brandon-chrostowski-named-silver-plate-recipient/article_44cb90d8-5fe5-11ea-99be-9f6a75bdf807.html|title=Brandon Chrostowski named 2020 Silver Plate recipient|last=Raspe|first=Becky|website=https://www.clevelandjewishnews.com}}</ref>

column4:
{{short description|Political party in the Philippines}} {{About|the party founded in 2009|the original party founded in 1991|Lakas–CMD (1991)}} {{Infobox Philippine political party | name = Lakas–Christian Muslim Democrats | native_name = Lakas–Demokratang Kristiyano at Muslim
(Lakas–CMD) | logo = [[File:Lakas CMD.svg|200px]] | colorcode = #ff8000 | president = [[Martin Romualdez]] | chairman = [[Bong Revilla Jr.]] | secretary_general = [[Prospero Pichay Jr.]] | founder = [[Fidel Ramos]]

{{Start date and age|2008|6|18}} (modern) | merger = [[Lakas–CMD (1991)|Lakas–CMD]] and [[KAMPI]] | headquarters = CLMC Building, Unit 601, 6th Floor, 259 [[EDSA (road)|Epifanio de los Santos Avenue]], Greenhills East, [[Mandaluyong]], 1554 [[Metro Manila]] | ideology = {{nowrap|[[Christian democracy]]

[[Liberal conservatism]]
[[Federalism in the Philippines|Federalism]]{{cite web |url=https://newsinfo.inquirer.net/1127176/romualdez-reaffirms-support-for-dutertes-federalism-agenda/amp |title=Romualdez reaffirms support for Duterte’s federalism agenda |date=2019-06-05|accessdate=2020-01-16}}{{cite web|last=Manalastas|first=Jester P. |url=https://journal.com.ph/news/nation/federalism-push-renewed |title=Federalism push renewed |date=2019-06-05|accessdate=2020-01-16}}}} | position = [[Centrism|Centre]] to [[Centre-right politics|Centre-right]]

column1: | colors = {{Color box|{{Lakas-Christian Muslim Democrats/meta/color}}|border=darkgray}} {{Color box|gold|border=darkgray}} {{Color box|green|border=darkgray}} {{Color box|orange|border=darkgray}} [[Sky blue]]
column4: [[Orange (colour)|orange]]

column1: '''Lakas–CMD''' ('''Lakas–Christian Muslim Democrats''') is a [[centre-right politics|center-right]] political party in the [[Philippines]]
column2: influenced by [[Christian democracy]] and [[Islamic democracy]]. The current party originated in 2009 with the merger of the [[Lakas–CMD (1991)|original Lakas–CMD]] party with the [[Kabalikat ng Malayang Pilipino]] (KAMPI); it was known as '''Lakas–Kampi–CMD''' until 2012. The party produced one president
column4: who was president when the two parties merged in 2009.

column1: With Arroyo unable to run for a new term due to term limits
column2: the party lost the [[2010 Philippine presidential election|2010 presidential election]] with [[Gilberto Teodoro]] as its presidential nominee. The party retained its two [[Philippine Senate|senators]]
column4: in the [[2010 Philippine Senate election|Senate election]] and became a part of the [[Liberal Party (Philippines)|Liberal Party]]-led majority coalition; in the [[2010 Philippine House of Representatives elections|House of Representatives election]]
column5: it won 47% of the seats contested in the district election
column6: but most of its members were split into three groups
column7: with many defecting to the Liberal Party
column8: some formed the [[National Unity Party (Philippines)|National Unity Party]]
column9: and the remaining members were split into the majority and minority blocs
column10: with its members heading the minority. On May 11
column12: the party decided to revert to its original name and drop Arroyo's KAMPI from the coalition.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.manilatimes.net/index.php/news/top-stories/22728-lakas-drops-gmas-kampi-from-coalition |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-05-14 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120514081052/http://www.manilatimes.net/index.php/news/top-stories/22728-lakas-drops-gmas-kampi-from-coalition |archivedate=2012-05-14 }} The Manila Times: Lakas drops GMA's Kampi from coalition</ref> Lakas–CMD is currently one of the parties in opposition. In 2013
column13: Sen. [[Bong Revilla]] became chairman of Lakas. He was supposed to be the standard bearer of the party in the [[2016 Philippine presidential election|2016 presidential election]] prior to his detention at the [[Philippine National Police|PNP]] custodial center at [[Camp Crame]] due to his alleged involvement in the [[Priority Development Assistance Fund scam|pork barrel scam]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/350361/bong-revilla-a-strong-contender-in-2016-lakas-cmd|title=Bong Revilla a strong contender in 2016 – Lakas-CMD|first=Karen|last=Boncocan|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|date=31 January 2013 }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title = Bong Revilla off to surrender to anti-graft court|url = http://www.rappler.com/nation/61091-bong-revilla-heads-for-sandiganbayan-to-submit-self-to-court|website = Rappler|accessdate = 2015-11-11}}</ref>

column1: Lakas–CMD has always focused on economic growth and development
column4: and strong cooperation between the executive and legislative branches of government. It is known for its advocacy of a shift from the present [[presidential system]] to a parliamentary form of government through constitutional amendments and through establishing peace talks with [[Islam in the Philippines|Muslim]] separatists and [[communism|communist]] rebels. The party democracy is distinct in its ecumenical inclusion of Muslim leaders in its political alliance.<ref name= \"Centre-right\" >{{cite web|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=YCrTDQAAQBAJ&pg=PA195&|title=Southeast Asia In The New International Era|newspaper=|date=2016|author1=|author2=|accessdate=April 19

column1: Lakas ng Tao was formed in December 1991 for the [[1992 Philippine general election|1992 elections]] as retired General
column3: [[Fidel V. Ramos]] and former [[Cebu]] Governor [[Emilio Mario Osmeña|Emilio Mario \"Lito\" R. Osmeña]] were running for president and vice-president respectively. It was also formed when Ramos bolted from the [[Laban ng Demokratikong Pilipino]] (LDP; Struggle of Democratic Filipinos)
column4: after he had lost in the bid for the presidency under that said banner to Speaker [[Ramon Mitra]].

column1: The party was formed out of two parties: Ramos's Partido Lakas ng Tao (People Power Party) and the National Union of Christian Democrats of [[Raul Manglapus]].  As they coalesced
column2: the party became known as Lakas ng Tao-[[Lakas–CMD (1991)|National Union of Christian Democrats]]
column3: with Lakas ng Tao usually just shortened to \"Lakas\" and abbreviated as Lakas-NUCD.

column2: it formed a coalition government with the LDP for the [[1995 Philippine general election|1995 legislative elections]].  This coalition
column4: won a majority in both Houses of Congress. In the 1997 Lakas National Convention
column5: the party nominated House Speaker [[Jose de Venecia
column6: Jr.]] of [[Pangasinan]] after a close nominal fight with then Defense Secretary [[Renato de Villa]] as its nominee to the presidency against the opposition's Vice President [[Joseph Estrada]] in the [[1998 Philippine general election|1998 elections]].  By this time
column7: it was joined by the Union of Muslim Democrats of the Philippines of former ambassador to Egypt and Oman [[Sanchez Ali|Sanchez A. Ali]] to form Lakas ng EDSA-National Union of Christian Democrats-United Muslim Democrats of the Philippines.

column1: Secretary de Villa eventually bolted the party and formed [[Partido ng Demokratikong Reporma]] (Democratic Reform Party) for the [[1998 Philippine general election|1998 elections]].  Lakas also nominated then-Senator [[Gloria Macapagal-Arroyo]] of [[Pampanga]] as its candidate as [[Vice President of the Philippines|vice president]]. Arroyo had originally intended to run for president under her party
column2: [[Kabalikat ng Malayang Pilipino|Kabalikat ng Mamamayang Pilipino]] (KAMPI). De Venecia lost to Vice President Estrada by a significant plurality
column3: while Arroyo won the vice presidency in the same manner while her KAMPI party was in hiatus.

column1: In the [[2004 Philippine general election|2004 elections]]
column2: the name changed again to the current Lakas-Christian Muslim Democrats
column4: the meaning of Lakas in the party name is usually now referred to as \"Lakas ng [[EDSA I|EDSA]]\" which means \"The Strength of EDSA\" than the original Lakas ng Tao which means \"The Strength of the People\" or \"People Power.\"  This is also the name that it used when it ran in 2004 elections under the K-4 coalition.  President Arroyo
column5: who succeeded the deposed President [[Joseph Estrada]]
column6: was the K-4 Coalition candidate for president in the 2004 election
column7: eventually winning over her opponents primarily [[Fernando Poe
column8: Jr.]] and Senator [[Panfilo Lacson]].<ref name= \"Centre-right\" />

column2: Lakas–CMD was torn by factional rivalry between supporters of President Arroyo and supporters of former President [[Fidel V. Ramos]].  Issues include transitory provisions in a proposed Constitution to scrap mid-term elections (or \"no-el\") set for 2007 and calls for her to step down in time for the elections
column3: which is related to the \"no-el\" controversy. The party held its Annual Party Directorate Meeting on January 14
column4: 2006 to discuss these matters.

column1: There are no official results available of the 2007 [[elections in the Philippines|elections]] released by the party but according to the [[Philippine House of Representatives]]
column2: the party holds 79 out of 235 seats.

column3: Lakas spokesman and legal counsel [[Raul Lambino]] stated that Lakas–CMD officially released the list of senatorial bets for 2010—spokesman  in 2010. Except for Parañaque Representative Eduardo Zialcita
column4: they were not yet identified. But Lambino named incumbent Senators [[Ramon Revilla
column5: Jr.]] and [[Lito Lapid]]
column6: former senator [[Ralph Recto]] and former Congressman [[Prospero Pichay]] as among those considered.<ref>[http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/breakingnews/nation/view/20080116-112714/Lakas-lists-down-30-senatorial-bets-for-2010--spokesman  Inquirer.net
column7: Lakas lists down 30 senatorial bets for 2010--spokesman] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120910230132/http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/breakingnews/nation/view/20080116-112714/Lakas-lists-down-30-senatorial-bets-for-2010--spokesman |date=2012-09-10 }}</ref>

column1: Former Speaker of the House [[Jose de Venecia
column2: Jr.]] (Pangasinan -4th District) resigned his post as president of Lakas–CMD on March 10
column3: 2008; he rejected the proposition of former president [[Fidel Ramos]] to give him the title Chairman-emeritus. The current Speaker of the House [[Prospero Nograles]] (Davao -1st District) was sworn it as the new president of Lakas–CMD party and former Speaker of the house [[Feliciano Belmonte
column4: Jr.]] as vice president for Metro Manila affairs on the same day.

column1: [[President of the Philippines|President]] [[Gloria Macapagal-Arroyo]] on June 18
column3: confirmed the historical [[merger]] of the [[Lakas-CMD (1991)|Lakas-Christian Muslim Democrats]] (Lakas–CMD) and the [[Kabalikat ng Malayang Pilipino]] (KAMPI) parties. Both parties adopted the \"equity of the incumbent\" principle
column4: as the merger would account for almost 200 national and 8
column5: 000 local officials
column6: amid Mrs. Arroyo's prediction of  2010 elections victory. [[Prospero Nograles]]
column7: Lakas President and Kampi Chair [[Ronaldo Puno]] signed the covenant at the [[Davao City]] regional [[caucus]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.manilastandardtoday.com/?page=news4_june19_2008|title=Manila Standard Today - Latest News in the Philippines|publisher=|accessdate=19 April 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gmanews.tv/story/101994/Lakas-CMD-Kampi-merge|title=Lakas-CMD
column8: Kampi merge|work=GMA News Online|accessdate=19 April 2015}}</ref> Former President and Lakas–CMD Chairman Emeritus [[Fidel V. Ramos]] announced on February 6
column9: 2008 that Lakas–CMD would be the surviving entity after its merger with [[Kabalikat ng Malayang Pilipino|KAMPI]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/breakingnews/nation/view/20080206-117116/Ramos-De-Venecia-to-remain-president-in-Lakas-Kampi-merger|title=Ramos: De Venecia to remain president in Lakas-Kampi merger - INQUIRER.net
column10: Philippine News for Filipinos|accessdate=19 April 2015|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141223035729/http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/breakingnews/nation/view/20080206-117116/Ramos-De-Venecia-to-remain-president-in-Lakas-Kampi-merger|archivedate=23 December 2014}}</ref>

column4: Jr.]] and Former President [[Fidel V. Ramos]] led fifty members from the Lakas Kampi CMD in objecting to its merger with [[Kabalikat ng Malayang Pilipino]] (KAMPI) on May 28
column5: 2009. The faction made de Venecia its President with Ramos as the Chairman Emeritus of the new party
column6: Ramos refused the offer of Chairman Emeritus of Lakas-Kampi after being named in interim party organization. De Venecia has filed a resolution at the [[Commission on Elections (Philippines)|Commission on Elections]] to declare ''null and void'' the merger.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/inquirerheadlines/nation/view/20090909-224323/Lakas-Kampi-CMD-merger-in-peril|title=Lakas-Kampi-CMD merger in peril - INQUIRER.net
column7: Philippine News for Filipinos|accessdate=19 April 2015|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150427162726/http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/inquirerheadlines/nation/view/20090909-224323/Lakas-Kampi-CMD-merger-in-peril|archivedate=27 April 2015}}</ref> However
column8: the [[Supreme Court of the Philippines|Supreme Court]] ultimately upheld the legality of the merger
column9: <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.manilastandardtoday.com/insideNation.htm?f=2010/january/1/nation3.isx&d=/2010/january/1|title=Manila Standard Today - Latest News in the Philippines|publisher=|accessdate=19 April 2015}}</ref> citing the failure of de Venecia \"to sufficiently show that any grave abuse of discretion was committed by the [[Commission on Elections (Philippines)|Commission on Elections]] in rendering the challenged resolution.\"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.philstar.com/Article.aspx?articleId=537212&publicationSubCategoryId=63|title=Taxi hinoldap|work=philstar.com|accessdate=19 April 2015}}</ref>

column1: Since [[Benigno Aquino III]] was sworn in as President of the Philippines on June 30
column3: the majority of the former legislative member of Lakas-Kampi were sworn as a members of the reborn [[Liberal Party (Philippines)|Liberal Party]]. In 2011
column4: the legislators led by [[Pablo P. Garcia]] established the neutral [[National Unity Party (Philippines)|National Unity Party]]
column5: which has many similarities with the [[Nationalist People's Coalition]]. In 2013
column6: the party suffered its largest decline
column7: due  to the arrest of the party's [[matriarchy|matriarch]]
column8: Gloria Arroyo; however the remaining party largely supports the [[United Nationalist Alliance]]
column9: with candidates from among its former members such as [[Migz Zubiri]]
column10: [[Richard Gordon (politician)|Richard Gordon]] and [[Mitos Magsaysay]].

column1: In the [[2016 Philippine presidential election|2016 Presidential Elections]]
column2: Lakas supports the candidacy of [[Rodrigo Roa Duterte|Rodrigo \"Rody/Digong\" Duterte]] and [[Ferdinand Marcos
column4: Jr.]] for President and Vice President respectively
column5: which Duterte won and Marcos lost to Liberal Party candidate [[Leni Robredo|Ma. Leonora \"Leni\" Robredo]]. In July 2017
column6: Revilla was sworn into Duterte's party [[PDP-Laban]]
column7: and in October
column8: Macapagal Arroyo and her allies
column9: also joins PDP-Laban
column10: as a result Lakas has been dissolved.

column1: '''Lakas–CMD''' ('''Lakas–Christian Muslim Democrats''') is a [[centre-right politics|center-right]] political party in the [[Philippines]]
column2: influenced by [[Christian democracy]] and [[Islamic democracy]]. The current party originated in 2009 with the merger of the [[Lakas–CMD (1991)|original Lakas–CMD]] party with the [[Kabalikat ng Malayang Pilipino]] (KAMPI); it was known as '''Lakas–Kampi–CMD''' until 2012. The party produced one president
column4: who was president when the two parties merged in 2009.

column1: With Arroyo unable to run for a new term due to term limits
column2: the party lost the [[2010 Philippine presidential election|2010 presidential election]] with [[Gilberto Teodoro]] as its presidential nominee. The party retained its two [[Philippine Senate|senators]]
column4: in the [[2010 Philippine Senate election|Senate election]] and became a part of the [[Liberal Party (Philippines)|Liberal Party]]-led majority coalition; in the [[2010 Philippine House of Representatives elections|House of Representatives election]]
column5: it won 47% of the seats contested in the district election
column6: but most of its members were split into three groups
column7: with many defecting to the Liberal Party
column8: some formed the [[National Unity Party (Philippines)|National Unity Party]]
column9: and the remaining members were split into the majority and minority blocs
column10: with its members heading the minority. On May 11
column12: the party decided to revert to its original name and drop Arroyo's KAMPI from the coalition.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.manilatimes.net/index.php/news/top-stories/22728-lakas-drops-gmas-kampi-from-coalition |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-05-14 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120514081052/http://www.manilatimes.net/index.php/news/top-stories/22728-lakas-drops-gmas-kampi-from-coalition |archivedate=2012-05-14 }} The Manila Times: Lakas drops GMA's Kampi from coalition</ref> Lakas–CMD is currently one of the parties in opposition. In 2013
column13: Sen. [[Bong Revilla]] became chairman of Lakas. He was supposed to be the standard bearer of the party in the [[2016 Philippine presidential election|2016 presidential election]] prior to his detention at the [[Philippine National Police|PNP]] custodial center at [[Camp Crame]] due to his alleged involvement in the [[Priority Development Assistance Fund scam|pork barrel scam]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/350361/bong-revilla-a-strong-contender-in-2016-lakas-cmd|title=Bong Revilla a strong contender in 2016 – Lakas-CMD|first=Karen|last=Boncocan|work=[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]|date=31 January 2013 }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|title = Bong Revilla off to surrender to anti-graft court|url = http://www.rappler.com/nation/61091-bong-revilla-heads-for-sandiganbayan-to-submit-self-to-court|website = Rappler|accessdate = 2015-11-11}}</ref>

column1: Lakas–CMD has always focused on economic growth and development
column4: and strong cooperation between the executive and legislative branches of government. It is known for its advocacy of a shift from the present [[presidential system]] to a parliamentary form of government through constitutional amendments and through establishing peace talks with [[Islam in the Philippines|Muslim]] separatists and [[communism|communist]] rebels. The party democracy is distinct in its ecumenical inclusion of Muslim leaders in its political alliance.<ref name= \"Centre-right\" >{{cite web|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=YCrTDQAAQBAJ&pg=PA195&|title=Southeast Asia In The New International Era|newspaper=|date=2016|author1=|author2=|accessdate=April 19

Rajesh]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Anupama Subramanian DC chennai |url=http://www.deccanchronicle.com/channels/showbiz/kollywood/udhay%E2%80%99s-new-look-okok-912 |title=Udhay’s new look in OKOK |publisher=[[Deccan Chronicle]] |date=2011-03-23 |accessdate=2011-12-17}}</ref> It stars producer [[Udhayanidhi Stalin]]

column2: Saravanan receives his ex-girlfriend Meera's wedding invitation. He and his friend Paarthasarathy aka Paartha leave for [[Pondicherry]] to attend the wedding via car. ''En route''
column3: Saravanan recollects his past: He was a ruthless youth working in a film theatre with Paartha. He lives with his parents; his father
column4: Varadharajan
column5: who is educated and works as a college professor and his mother
column6: Shenbagam
column7: who is uneducated and is trying to pass an exam
column8: just to get her college degree. One day in traffic
column9: he sees Meera
column10: a girl training to be an air hostess and [[Love at first sight|falls for her on site]]. He follows her to a cloth shop and also to her Air Hostess class. He saw her house and he and Partha go to her house
column11: as Meera calls them. There
column12: Meera threatens Saravanan by showing her father's photo
column13: who is a Deputy Commissioner of Police (DCP)
column14: Mahendra Kumar. But still
column15: Saravanan follows her and asks her to love him. Meera takes him to Mahendra Kumar's office and he asks Saravanan to stop following Meera. Meera tells Saravanan that she has some qualifications required by her lover like shaving regularly
column19: etc.  Saravanan tells this to Partha and Partha asks him if he or Meera is best for him. Saravanan tells him Meera is more important to him than Paartha
column20: causing a break between Saravanan's and Paartha's friendship.

column2: Saravanan joins Paartha's broken love and asks him to rejoin his love. Partha agrees and then they go to [[Mumbai]]
column3: following Meera in a flight. There
column4: Meera alas tells him that she loves Saravanan. After some months
column5: Meera calls Saravanan once
column6: but he does not pick up the phone and tells Paartha that Meera is not his real love and it is all nothing
column7: but a drama. But
column8: he really said that for fun. But
column9: Paartha had accidentally switched on the phone while Saravanan told him all this. Meera
column10: mistaking him for intentionally misusing her
column11: comes there and breaks their love. Now
column12: at Pondicherry
column13: during Meera's marriage
column14: both Saravanan and Partha end up drunk and tell a small story
column15: in a comical way describing the broken love of Saravanan and Meera. Just as the marriage is going to happen
column18: comes there with a pregnant girl and his girlfriend and reveals that Meera's groom has a girlfriend
column19: who is pregnant by him and that the girl Rajini Murugan is with
column20: is that girl. The groom admits to his mistake and reunites with his old girlfriend. Saravanan and Paartha walk off the marriage hall
column21: just then Meera comes and hugs Saravanan

Udhayanidhi Stalin had bought the distribution rights of Rajesh's previous film ''[[Boss Engira Bhaskaran]]''.<ref>[http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/58980.html Red Giant acquires Boss Engira Bhaskaran – Tamil Movie News]. IndiaGlitz (2010-07-29). Retrieved on 2012-05-08.</ref> As the film emerged successful
column2: Udhayanidhi decided to continue the collaboration
column3: going on to play the lead role in the new project.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://chennai365.com/news/udhayanidhi-is-the-hero-for-director-rajesh/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=12 April 2012 |url-status=unfit |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100811210306/http://chennai365.com/news/udhayanidhi-is-the-hero-for-director-rajesh/ |archivedate=11 August 2010 }}. chennai365.com. June 2

column2: several actresses including [[Asin Thottumkal]] and [[Nayantara]] were approached to play the female lead but [[Hansika Motwani]] was eventually signed. The protagonist was revealed to be an unemployed youngster
column3: as unofficial reports of a ticket collector and a band master were brushed aside.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/64612.html |title=Who is Udhayanidhi in 'OK OK'? |publisher=IndiaGlitz |date=2011-03-07 |accessdate=2011-12-17}}</ref> [[Arya (actor)|Arya]]
column4: [[Sneha (actress)|Sneha]] and [[Andrea Jeremiah]] were roped in to perform cameo roles.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/69565.html |title=Arya to do a cameo |publisher=IndiaGlitz |date=2011-08-08 |accessdate=2011-12-17}}</ref> Hansika was forced to learn [[Tamil language|Tamil]]
column5: for the director wanted her to speak fluently in the film.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/73418.html |title=Hansika masters Tamil? |publisher=IndiaGlitz |date=2011-11-02 |accessdate=2011-12-17}}</ref> Rajesh planned to retain the same crew members from his first two ventures but since Udhayanidhi wanted [[Harris Jayaraj]] to score the music for his debut film
column6: he was signed over Rajesh's usual associate [[Yuvan Shankar Raja]]
column7: while the makers decided to proceed with Balasubramaniam as the cinematographer as [[Sakthi Saravanan]] was unavailable.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/mar-11-02/ok-ok-rajesh-08-03-11.html |title=Okok Shoot To Commence |publisher=Behindwoods |date=2011-03-08 |accessdate=2012-04-10}}</ref>

column1: A photo shoot for the film was held in February 2011 with the lead.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/feb-11-01/oru-kal-oru-kannadi-rajesh-07-02-11.html |title= Hansika OK OK |publisher=Behindwoods |date=2011-02-07 |accessdate=2011-12-17}}</ref> The shooting of the film began in March 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/64907.html |title=It's shooting time for 'OKOK' |publisher=IndiaGlitz |date=2011-03-16 |accessdate=2011-12-17}}</ref> Filming was held in [[Tidel Park]] and [[Old Mahabalipuram Road|Rajiv Gandhi Road]] in [[Chennai]] on 26 April. The car in which they drive to pondicherry was modified with power steering and other interesting elements. A pondicherry bar was setup in woodlands hotel campus.  In the song Azhage
column2: which was totally shot in dubai
column3: in between bgms were recreated in VGP beach and matched by art director [[Jacki]].<ref>[http://www.sify.com/movies/rajesh-s-nanbenda-becomes-okok-news-tamil-lbsjuleeaej.html?scategory=tamil Rajesh's Nanbenda becomes OKOK]. Sify.com (2011-01-19). Retrieved on 2012-05-08.</ref> Overseas shooting locations included Jordan and [[Abu Dhabi]]
column4: where the film's team flew over to shoot a song in December 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/okok-team-flies-to-jordan-news-tamil-lmriPSiebde.html |title=OKOK team flies to Jordan |publisher=[[Sify]] |date=2011-12-17 |accessdate=2011-12-17}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/dec-11-04/udayanidhi-stalin-oru-kal-oru-kannadi-27-12-11.html |title=Ok Ok Dubai Schedule Completed |publisher=Behindwoods |date=2011-12-27 |accessdate=2012-04-10}}</ref> Some shots were canned at the PVR theater in Ampa Mall
column5: Aminjikarai. Hansika Motwani and Saranya were spotted doing a scene together in the theater.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/mar-11-04/okok-udhayanidhi-stalin-28-03-11.html |title=Hansika Motwani Spotted At Pvr Theaters |publisher=Behindwoods |date=2011-03-28 |accessdate=2012-04-10}}</ref> In the second schedule
column6: director Rajesh shot a scene on Udayanidhi Stalin
column7: Azhagam Perumal and Saranya Ponvannan at [[KK Nagar]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/may-11-03/udayanidhi-stalin-hansika-motwani-21-05-11.html |title=Ok Ok Shooting Wrapped Up |publisher=Behindwoods |date=2011-05-21 |accessdate=2012-04-10}}</ref> During a schedule
column8: Santhanam was hospitalized due to illness
column9: delaying the shoot.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/apr-11-01/santhanam-okok-05-04-11.html |title=Santhanam Is Possessed! |publisher=Behindwoods |date=2011-04-05 |accessdate=2012-04-10}}</ref>

column1: The satellite rights of the film were sold to [[Sun TV (India)|Sun TV]]. Oru Kal Oru Kannadi was released on 13 April 2012 in Tamil as a [[Tamil New Year]] release and on 31 August 2012 in Telugu.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.moviegalleri.net/2012/03/oru-kal-oru-kannadi-movie-release-date-on-april-13th-friday.html |title=OKOK Movie Release date on April 13th}}</ref>

column2: <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/78907.html |title='OKOK' track details |publisher=IndiaGlitz |date=2012-03-05 |accessdate=2012-04-10}}</ref> composed by [[Harris Jayaraj]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/feb-11-04/ok-ok-rajesh-25-02-11.html |title=On Harris Replacing Yuvan |publisher=Behindwoods |date=2011-02-25 |accessdate=2012-04-10}}</ref> The composing sessions took place in [[Singapore]] and [[Ooty]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/64808.html |title=Harris in Singapore. OKOK |publisher=IndiaGlitz |date=2011-03-12 |accessdate=2011-12-17}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/mar-11-02/okok-udhayanidhi-stalin-12-03-11.html |title=Harris Jeyaraj In Singapore |publisher=Behindwoods |date=2011-03-12 |accessdate=2012-04-10}}</ref> The audio launch was held at the Sathyam Cinemas on 4 March 2012. Actors Karthi
column4: Jeeva and Arya were present at the event.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/78955.html |title=Suriya unveils 'Oru Kal Oru Kannadi' music |publisher=IndiaGlitz |date=2012-03-06 |accessdate=2012-04-10}}</ref> A three-minute trailer and song sequences was screened for the guests and media people as well.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tamil.oneindia.in/movies/news/2012/02/okok-music-from-march-5-aid0136.html |title=OKOK music from March 5 | மார்ச் 5-ம் தேதி ஒரு கல் ஒரு கண்ணாடி இசை! – Oneindia Tamil |publisher=Tamil.oneindia.in |date= |accessdate=2012-02-23}}</ref>

column1: The soundtrack received generally positive reviews. Behindwoods.com claimed that it \"definitely has a few like-able singalongs to keep the audio outlets happy\"
column2: providing a rating of 3/5.<ref>[http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-music-reviews/review-1/mar-12-01/oru-kal-oru-kannadi-music-review.html Oru Kal Oru Kannadi Music Review – Oru Kal Oru Kannadi Music Review]. Behindwoods.com. Retrieved on 2012-05-08.</ref> The Song Venam Machan Venam became an Instant hit and topped the chart for several weeks.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.paatuvarigal.com/2015/01/venam-machan-venam-song-lyrics-from-oru.html|title=Venam Machan Venam Song Lyrics from Oru Kal Oru Kannadi|work=Paatuvarigal – Tamil Song Lyrics|access-date=2018-05-30}}</ref> Indiaglitz.com mentioned that the composer had \"fulfilled the director's expectations
column3: as the songs strike a chord during the first-listen itself. 'Oru Kal Oru Kannadi' music album celebrates love and reflects youngsters
column4: like the previous films of Rajesh.\"<ref>[http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/musicreview/12922.html Oru Kal Oru Kannadi Music Review songs lyrics]. IndiaGlitz (2012-03-07). Retrieved on 2012-05-08.</ref>

column1: | headline= Track-List<ref>{{cite web |title=Oru Kal Oru Kannadi - All Songs - Download or Listen Free - Saavn |url=https://www.saavn.com/album/oru-kal-oru-kannadi/LJr5u9Xt-Kw_ |accessdate=4 November 2018 |date=5 March 2012}}</ref>

| headline = Telugu Track-List<ref>{{cite web |title=Ok Ok - All Songs - Download or Listen Free - Saavn |url=https://www.saavn.com/album/ok-ok/53mw6rQvL4Q_ |accessdate=4 November 2018 |date=8 July 2012}}</ref>
''Oru Kal Oru Kannadi'' received positive reviews and became a blockbuster at the box office. ''[[Sify]] ''called it a \"rollicking comedy\"
column2: stating: \"If all you're looking for is a relaxed time at the movies
column4: this is Good Fun. Go with your buddies
column5: you'll laugh till you have tears in your eyes\".<ref>{{cite web|title=Oru Kal Oru Kannadi is Rollicking comedy|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/oru-kal-oru-kannadi-review-tamil-14996316.html|publisher=Sify |date= |accessdate=14 April 2012}}</ref> ''[[The Times of India]]'' rated it 3.5 out of 5 and said: \"M Rajesh is a rarity in Tamil cinema. How else does one explain sitting through almost a three-hour-long movie without realising the passage of time?\"<ref>{{cite news|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/regional/tamil/movie-reviews/Oru-Kal-Oru-Kannadi/movie-review/12659866.cms |title=Oru Kal Oru Kannadi Review |publisher=[[The Times of India]] |date= |accessdate=14 April 2012}}{{Rating|3.5|5}}</ref> ''IndiaGlitz'' said \"Oru Kal Oru Kannadi – Humour At Its Best!\" and wrote that it was a \"clean and convincing film that makes you laugh every minute\".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/review/12922.html |title=Oru Kal Oru Kannadi – Humour At Its Best! |publisher=IndiaGlitz |date= |accessdate=14 April 2012}}</ref> ''Behindwoods.com'' rated the film 3 out of 5
column6: stating: \"OKOK double OK\".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-reviews/reviews-2/apr-12-02/oru-kal-oru-kannadi-review.html |title=Oru Kal Oru Kannadi Review |publisher=Behindwoods |date= |accessdate=14 April 2012}}{{Rating|3|5}}</ref> Oneindia stated that the film \"may not have a great storyline
column7: but watching the film is worth every penny\".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://entertainment.oneindia.in/tamil/reviews/2012/oru-kal-oru-kannadi-review-140412.html |title=Oru Kal Oru Kannadi – Review |publisher=Oneindia |date=|accessdate=14 April 2012}}</ref> Rohit Ramachandran of Nowrunning.com stated that it was \"by no means a meaningful film experience
column8: but it is a portal for popcorn escapism\".<ref>[http://www.nowrunning.com/movie/8703/tamil/oru-kal-oru-kannadi/3665/review.htm Oru Kal Oru Kannadi Review – Tamil Movie Review by Rohit Ramachandran]. Nowrunning.com (2012-04-14). Retrieved on 2012-05-08.</ref> Pavithra Srinivasan from [[Rediff.com]] rated it 2 out of 5 and said: \"''OKOK'' is a slightly torturous friendship story of two guys and that's pretty much it\".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/report/south-review-oru-kal-oru-kannaadi-is-tortuous/20120413.htm |title=Review: Oru Kal
column9: Oru Kannaadi is tortuous |publisher=Rediff|date=|accessdate=14 April 2012}}{{Rating|2|5}}</ref>

column1: ''Oru Kal Oru Kannadi'' opened in more than 300 screens
column2: with an average of 95 per cent theatre occupancy in urban regions.<ref name=\"behindwoods1\" /> The film began to collect even larger sums of revenue in the next four continuous weeks
column3: acquiring a total of {{INR}}15.09 crore in a matter of 25 days in [[Chennai]].<ref name=\"behindwoods1\" /><ref name=\"indiaglitz1\">{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/82110.html |title=Karthi — Kajal team up again? - Tamil Movie News |publisher=IndiaGlitz |date=2012-05-14 |accessdate=2012-08-05}}</ref> The film claimed top spot for more than a month at the Chennai box office. Trade pundits declared the film's collections as impressive.<ref name=\"behindwoods1\" /><ref name=\"indiaglitz1\" /><ref>{{cite news| url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-04-23/news-interviews/31386464_1_comedy-films-scripts-rights | work=The Times Of India | title=OK OK remake rights becomes hot}}</ref> Taken with a budget of {{INR}}13 crore it grossed around {{INR}}42 crore worldwide.<ref name=\"Sify\" />

column9: he sees Meera
column10: a girl training to be an air hostess and [[Love at first sight|falls for her on site]]. He follows her to a cloth shop and also to her Air Hostess class. He saw her house and he and Partha go to her house
column11: as Meera calls them. There
column12: Meera threatens Saravanan by showing her father's photo
column13: who is a Deputy Commissioner of Police (DCP)
column14: Mahendra Kumar. But still
column15: Saravanan follows her and asks her to love him. Meera takes him to Mahendra Kumar's office and he asks Saravanan to stop following Meera. Meera tells Saravanan that she has some qualifications required by her lover like shaving regularly
column19: etc.  Saravanan tells this to Partha and Partha asks him if he or Meera is best for him. Saravanan tells him Meera is more important to him than Paartha
column20: causing a break between Saravanan's and Paartha's friendship.

column2: Saravanan joins Paartha's broken love and asks him to rejoin his love. Partha agrees and then they go to [[Mumbai]]

column4: Meera alas tells him that she loves Saravanan. After some months

column6: but he does not pick up the phone and tells Paartha that Meera is not his real love and it is all nothing
column7: but a drama. But
column8: he really said that for fun. But
column9: Paartha had accidentally switched on the phone while Saravanan told him all this. Meera
column10: mistaking him for intentionally misusing her
column11: comes there and breaks their love. Now
column12: at Pondicherry
column13: during Meera's marriage
column14: both Saravanan and Partha end up drunk and tell a small story
column15: in a comical way describing the broken love of Saravanan and Meera. Just as the marriage is going to happen
column18: comes there with a pregnant girl and his girlfriend and reveals that Meera's groom has a girlfriend
column19: who is pregnant by him and that the girl Rajini Murugan is with

column1: * [[Andrea Jeremiah]] as Rajini Murugan's girlfriend [special appearce]

* [[Dinesh Kumar (choreographer)|Dinesh Kumar]] (special appearance in the song \"Kadhal Oru\")<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xAfHFFi0O6E |title=Oru Kal Oru Kannadi — Kaadhal Oru Video Udhayanidhi

Udhayanidhi Stalin had bought the distribution rights of Rajesh's previous film ''[[Boss Engira Bhaskaran]]''.<ref>[http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/58980.html Red Giant acquires Boss Engira Bhaskaran – Tamil Movie News]. IndiaGlitz (2010-07-29). Retrieved on 2012-05-08.</ref> As the film emerged successful
column2: Udhayanidhi decided to continue the collaboration
column3: going on to play the lead role in the new project.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://chennai365.com/news/udhayanidhi-is-the-hero-for-director-rajesh/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=12 April 2012 |url-status=unfit |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100811210306/http://chennai365.com/news/udhayanidhi-is-the-hero-for-director-rajesh/ |archivedate=11 August 2010 }}. chennai365.com. June 2

column2: several actresses including [[Asin Thottumkal]] and [[Nayantara]] were approached to play the female lead but [[Hansika Motwani]] was eventually signed. The protagonist was revealed to be an unemployed youngster
column3: as unofficial reports of a ticket collector and a band master were brushed aside.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/64612.html |title=Who is Udhayanidhi in 'OK OK'? |publisher=IndiaGlitz |date=2011-03-07 |accessdate=2011-12-17}}</ref> [[Arya (actor)|Arya]]
column4: [[Sneha (actress)|Sneha]] and [[Andrea Jeremiah]] were roped in to perform cameo roles.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/69565.html |title=Arya to do a cameo |publisher=IndiaGlitz |date=2011-08-08 |accessdate=2011-12-17}}</ref> Hansika was forced to learn [[Tamil language|Tamil]]
column5: for the director wanted her to speak fluently in the film.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/73418.html |title=Hansika masters Tamil? |publisher=IndiaGlitz |date=2011-11-02 |accessdate=2011-12-17}}</ref> Rajesh planned to retain the same crew members from his first two ventures but since Udhayanidhi wanted [[Harris Jayaraj]] to score the music for his debut film
column6: he was signed over Rajesh's usual associate [[Yuvan Shankar Raja]]
column7: while the makers decided to proceed with Balasubramaniam as the cinematographer as [[Sakthi Saravanan]] was unavailable.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/mar-11-02/ok-ok-rajesh-08-03-11.html |title=Okok Shoot To Commence |publisher=Behindwoods |date=2011-03-08 |accessdate=2012-04-10}}</ref>

column1: A photo shoot for the film was held in February 2011 with the lead.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/feb-11-01/oru-kal-oru-kannadi-rajesh-07-02-11.html |title= Hansika OK OK |publisher=Behindwoods |date=2011-02-07 |accessdate=2011-12-17}}</ref> The shooting of the film began in March 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/64907.html |title=It's shooting time for 'OKOK' |publisher=IndiaGlitz |date=2011-03-16 |accessdate=2011-12-17}}</ref> Filming was held in [[Tidel Park]] and [[Old Mahabalipuram Road|Rajiv Gandhi Road]] in [[Chennai]] on 26 April. The car in which they drive to pondicherry was modified with power steering and other interesting elements. A pondicherry bar was setup in woodlands hotel campus.  In the song Azhage
column2: which was totally shot in dubai
column3: in between bgms were recreated in VGP beach and matched by art director [[Jacki]].<ref>[http://www.sify.com/movies/rajesh-s-nanbenda-becomes-okok-news-tamil-lbsjuleeaej.html?scategory=tamil Rajesh's Nanbenda becomes OKOK]. Sify.com (2011-01-19). Retrieved on 2012-05-08.</ref> Overseas shooting locations included Jordan and [[Abu Dhabi]]
column4: where the film's team flew over to shoot a song in December 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/okok-team-flies-to-jordan-news-tamil-lmriPSiebde.html |title=OKOK team flies to Jordan |publisher=[[Sify]] |date=2011-12-17 |accessdate=2011-12-17}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/dec-11-04/udayanidhi-stalin-oru-kal-oru-kannadi-27-12-11.html |title=Ok Ok Dubai Schedule Completed |publisher=Behindwoods |date=2011-12-27 |accessdate=2012-04-10}}</ref> Some shots were canned at the PVR theater in Ampa Mall
column5: Aminjikarai. Hansika Motwani and Saranya were spotted doing a scene together in the theater.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/mar-11-04/okok-udhayanidhi-stalin-28-03-11.html |title=Hansika Motwani Spotted At Pvr Theaters |publisher=Behindwoods |date=2011-03-28 |accessdate=2012-04-10}}</ref> In the second schedule
column6: director Rajesh shot a scene on Udayanidhi Stalin
column7: Azhagam Perumal and Saranya Ponvannan at [[KK Nagar]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/may-11-03/udayanidhi-stalin-hansika-motwani-21-05-11.html |title=Ok Ok Shooting Wrapped Up |publisher=Behindwoods |date=2011-05-21 |accessdate=2012-04-10}}</ref> During a schedule
column8: Santhanam was hospitalized due to illness
column9: delaying the shoot.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/apr-11-01/santhanam-okok-05-04-11.html |title=Santhanam Is Possessed! |publisher=Behindwoods |date=2011-04-05 |accessdate=2012-04-10}}</ref>

column1: The satellite rights of the film were sold to [[Sun TV (India)|Sun TV]]. Oru Kal Oru Kannadi was released on 13 April 2012 in Tamil as a [[Tamil New Year]] release and on 31 August 2012 in Telugu.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.moviegalleri.net/2012/03/oru-kal-oru-kannadi-movie-release-date-on-april-13th-friday.html |title=OKOK Movie Release date on April 13th}}</ref>

column2: <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/78907.html |title='OKOK' track details |publisher=IndiaGlitz |date=2012-03-05 |accessdate=2012-04-10}}</ref> composed by [[Harris Jayaraj]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/feb-11-04/ok-ok-rajesh-25-02-11.html |title=On Harris Replacing Yuvan |publisher=Behindwoods |date=2011-02-25 |accessdate=2012-04-10}}</ref> The composing sessions took place in [[Singapore]] and [[Ooty]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/64808.html |title=Harris in Singapore. OKOK |publisher=IndiaGlitz |date=2011-03-12 |accessdate=2011-12-17}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-news-1/mar-11-02/okok-udhayanidhi-stalin-12-03-11.html |title=Harris Jeyaraj In Singapore |publisher=Behindwoods |date=2011-03-12 |accessdate=2012-04-10}}</ref> The audio launch was held at the Sathyam Cinemas on 4 March 2012. Actors Karthi
column4: Jeeva and Arya were present at the event.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/78955.html |title=Suriya unveils 'Oru Kal Oru Kannadi' music |publisher=IndiaGlitz |date=2012-03-06 |accessdate=2012-04-10}}</ref> A three-minute trailer and song sequences was screened for the guests and media people as well.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tamil.oneindia.in/movies/news/2012/02/okok-music-from-march-5-aid0136.html |title=OKOK music from March 5 | மார்ச் 5-ம் தேதி ஒரு கல் ஒரு கண்ணாடி இசை! – Oneindia Tamil |publisher=Tamil.oneindia.in |date= |accessdate=2012-02-23}}</ref>

column1: The soundtrack received generally positive reviews. Behindwoods.com claimed that it \"definitely has a few like-able singalongs to keep the audio outlets happy\"
column2: providing a rating of 3/5.<ref>[http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-music-reviews/review-1/mar-12-01/oru-kal-oru-kannadi-music-review.html Oru Kal Oru Kannadi Music Review – Oru Kal Oru Kannadi Music Review]. Behindwoods.com. Retrieved on 2012-05-08.</ref> The Song Venam Machan Venam became an Instant hit and topped the chart for several weeks.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.paatuvarigal.com/2015/01/venam-machan-venam-song-lyrics-from-oru.html|title=Venam Machan Venam Song Lyrics from Oru Kal Oru Kannadi|work=Paatuvarigal – Tamil Song Lyrics|access-date=2018-05-30}}</ref> Indiaglitz.com mentioned that the composer had \"fulfilled the director's expectations
column3: as the songs strike a chord during the first-listen itself. 'Oru Kal Oru Kannadi' music album celebrates love and reflects youngsters
column4: like the previous films of Rajesh.\"<ref>[http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/musicreview/12922.html Oru Kal Oru Kannadi Music Review songs lyrics]. IndiaGlitz (2012-03-07). Retrieved on 2012-05-08.</ref>

column1: | headline= Track-List<ref>{{cite web |title=Oru Kal Oru Kannadi - All Songs - Download or Listen Free - Saavn |url=https://www.saavn.com/album/oru-kal-oru-kannadi/LJr5u9Xt-Kw_ |accessdate=4 November 2018 |date=5 March 2012}}</ref>

| headline = Telugu Track-List<ref>{{cite web |title=Ok Ok - All Songs - Download or Listen Free - Saavn |url=https://www.saavn.com/album/ok-ok/53mw6rQvL4Q_ |accessdate=4 November 2018 |date=8 July 2012}}</ref>
''Oru Kal Oru Kannadi'' received positive reviews and became a blockbuster at the box office. ''[[Sify]] ''called it a \"rollicking comedy\"
column2: stating: \"If all you're looking for is a relaxed time at the movies
column4: this is Good Fun. Go with your buddies
column5: you'll laugh till you have tears in your eyes\".<ref>{{cite web|title=Oru Kal Oru Kannadi is Rollicking comedy|url=http://www.sify.com/movies/oru-kal-oru-kannadi-review-tamil-14996316.html|publisher=Sify |date= |accessdate=14 April 2012}}</ref> ''[[The Times of India]]'' rated it 3.5 out of 5 and said: \"M Rajesh is a rarity in Tamil cinema. How else does one explain sitting through almost a three-hour-long movie without realising the passage of time?\"<ref>{{cite news|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/regional/tamil/movie-reviews/Oru-Kal-Oru-Kannadi/movie-review/12659866.cms |title=Oru Kal Oru Kannadi Review |publisher=[[The Times of India]] |date= |accessdate=14 April 2012}}{{Rating|3.5|5}}</ref> ''IndiaGlitz'' said \"Oru Kal Oru Kannadi – Humour At Its Best!\" and wrote that it was a \"clean and convincing film that makes you laugh every minute\".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/review/12922.html |title=Oru Kal Oru Kannadi – Humour At Its Best! |publisher=IndiaGlitz |date= |accessdate=14 April 2012}}</ref> ''Behindwoods.com'' rated the film 3 out of 5
column6: stating: \"OKOK double OK\".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.behindwoods.com/tamil-movie-reviews/reviews-2/apr-12-02/oru-kal-oru-kannadi-review.html |title=Oru Kal Oru Kannadi Review |publisher=Behindwoods |date= |accessdate=14 April 2012}}{{Rating|3|5}}</ref> Oneindia stated that the film \"may not have a great storyline
column7: but watching the film is worth every penny\".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://entertainment.oneindia.in/tamil/reviews/2012/oru-kal-oru-kannadi-review-140412.html |title=Oru Kal Oru Kannadi – Review |publisher=Oneindia |date=|accessdate=14 April 2012}}</ref> Rohit Ramachandran of Nowrunning.com stated that it was \"by no means a meaningful film experience
column8: but it is a portal for popcorn escapism\".<ref>[http://www.nowrunning.com/movie/8703/tamil/oru-kal-oru-kannadi/3665/review.htm Oru Kal Oru Kannadi Review – Tamil Movie Review by Rohit Ramachandran]. Nowrunning.com (2012-04-14). Retrieved on 2012-05-08.</ref> Pavithra Srinivasan from [[Rediff.com]] rated it 2 out of 5 and said: \"''OKOK'' is a slightly torturous friendship story of two guys and that's pretty much it\".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rediff.com/movies/report/south-review-oru-kal-oru-kannaadi-is-tortuous/20120413.htm |title=Review: Oru Kal
column9: Oru Kannaadi is tortuous |publisher=Rediff|date=|accessdate=14 April 2012}}{{Rating|2|5}}</ref>

column1: ''Oru Kal Oru Kannadi'' opened in more than 300 screens
column2: with an average of 95 per cent theatre occupancy in urban regions.<ref name=\"behindwoods1\" /> The film began to collect even larger sums of revenue in the next four continuous weeks
column3: acquiring a total of {{INR}}15.09 crore in a matter of 25 days in [[Chennai]].<ref name=\"behindwoods1\" /><ref name=\"indiaglitz1\">{{cite web|url=http://www.indiaglitz.com/channels/tamil/article/82110.html |title=Karthi — Kajal team up again? - Tamil Movie News |publisher=IndiaGlitz |date=2012-05-14 |accessdate=2012-08-05}}</ref> The film claimed top spot for more than a month at the Chennai box office. Trade pundits declared the film's collections as impressive.<ref name=\"behindwoods1\" /><ref name=\"indiaglitz1\" /><ref>{{cite news| url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-04-23/news-interviews/31386464_1_comedy-films-scripts-rights | work=The Times Of India | title=OK OK remake rights becomes hot}}</ref> Taken with a budget of {{INR}}13 crore it grossed around {{INR}}42 crore worldwide.<ref name=\"Sify\" />
